p: The correlations of each KIRâ€“HLA receptor and ligand pair were analyzed. The observed frequencies for KIR2DL3 and HLA-C1 ligands showed a significant correlation (r = 0.637, p = 0.035). Positive correlations were also observed in KIR3DL1+HLA-Bw4, KIR3DL1+HLA-Bw4 80I, KIR3DL1+HLA-Bw4 80T, KIR2DL2+HLA-C1, KIR2DS1+HLA-C2, and KIR2DS2+HLA-C1 pairs, but they were not significant. Negative correlations between KIR3DS1 and HLA-Bw4, and KIR2DL1 and HLA-C2 were observed, but they were not significant neither ( Figure 3 and Supplementary Figure S1).
